description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 3.2 Birth RegistrationScale up improved delivery of, and equitable access to birth registration services using Mobile VRS and other Strategies., which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection â€“ General, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: PCR3 Keep Children SafeChildren's rights to protection are respected, protected and fulfilled in all private and public spaces.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 3.2 Birth RegistrationScale up improved delivery of, and equitable access to birth registration services using Mobile VRS andother Strategies.
Number of districts whose Planning units are using Mobile Vital Registration System to register birth of children under the age of five

actual.value: 2015:District Planning units of 62 districts including the 5 Divisions of Kampala City, are using Mobile VRS to register births of children under the age of five

title.narrative: Number of children 0 to 5 years old registered at birth in target districts using MVRS

actual.value: 2015:Since 2012, 2,267,625 (49.56% girls) children under 5 years old have cumulatively been registered using Mobile VRS, with UNICEF's support to 135 hospitals, 62 districts and the 5 Divisions of Kampala Capital City.

title.narrative: 1.% of health facilities (hospitals and health facilities level 4) providing birth registration services.

actual.value: 2015:40% (135 of the 335 health facilities). Mobile VRS has not yet been introduced to the 200 Health IVs due to the change in the legal framework and creation of new Authority for Identification and Registration of Persons
